channel.title: Uhmm I'm sure this has been asked before
channel.description: And I probably gonna regret asking but... How do i set the client to connect to my server by my ip address?

item.title: Uhmm I'm sure this has been asked before
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

To be honist im struggling with this aswell, Its been a year since i touched anything RSC. Since Piru Online Demonik based & Rscd based, First time ive seen and used this EasyRSC. I was messing around with SQL, Wamp & No-Ip. It seems to be giving me the error not binding the address. Im Port forwarded, Ive tried many things and still havent got it up yet, I figured maybe i had to edit the ip’s in the Conf.xml file as you use to in RSCD? Any helps would be much appreciated as i just want to have a look at things with my spare time. Thanks Dayle.

Read full topic
item.source: Uhmm I'm sure this has been asked before

item.title: Uhmm I'm sure this has been asked before
item.dc:creator: @remenissions remenissions
item.description:
@remenissions wrote:

Go under your servers folder > src > org > ***** > server. Then open the Server.java, , use the find tool under the edit tab. Search acceptor.bind(new Intersocketaddress then where it says “local” change it to ur gate way ip.

to get that go to your start button search cmd hit ok. then type “ipconfig /all” enter then look for ur default gateway. Then go to whatismyip.com get ur ip, change that under the settings.ini in ur client. then go to portforward.com and run through the guide there. If you can’t figre it out you can pay them to do it but its like 20$. cheaper just to do your self. Then it should work. if not you’ll just haft to search it, there are pleanty of guides out there I looked a few up to figure it out myself. not too difficult

Read full topic
item.source: Uhmm I'm sure this has been asked before
